txt.en: 'I hope one day to see you there.'
'Is it a chill of the body or of the spirit?'
'Let us move within the shelter of the rocks.'
'I understand, Silirtas.'
'I did not want to upset you.'
'I will see you there.'
'A wandering spirit has fastened its attention upon us.'
'Rest well until then.'
'I cannot say for certain.'
'This spirit might once have been the Kinta Silirtas...'
'...but even if it was, her memories may not remain.'
'This is dangerous, Sigileth!'
'TBD - Blah!'
'You cannot know this spirit was once Silirtas. You cannot!'
Hear what Sigileth believed of the spirit

Sigileth wishes to tell you about her return from the Fearwater with her brother and Cúridwan.
'Every moment!'
Sigileth describes her return from the Fearwater with her brother and Cúridwan.
'Silirtas understood that, and she did not run from it!'
Sigileth describes her return from the Fearwater with her brother and Cúridwan.
'TBD - Blah!'
'When first I came to Shonith, I thought its people were unlike any others I had encountered.'
'Their words and their customs were so different from my own.'
'But I recognized something in Silirtas.'
'Her hopes, her fears, her anger, and her frustrations...'
Sigileth describes her return from the Fearwater with her brother and Cúridwan.
'They were the same as mine.'
'TBD - Blah!'
'Our people have been separated by distance and by time, and we each came to forget.'
Sigileth describes her return from the Fearwater with her brother and Cúridwan.
'But we were fashioned as one people.'
Sigileth describes her return from the Fearwater with her brother and Cúridwan.
'There is a place for you, Silirtas, if you wish to seek it out!'
Sigileth describes her return from the Fearwater with her brother and Cúridwan.
'TBD - Blah!'
Sigileth describes her return from the Fearwater with her brother and Cúridwan.
'Just a... just a moment... I am sorry.'
Listen to Sigileth's account
Sigileth describes her return from the Fearwater with her brother and Cúridwan.
'I feel... I feel cold.'

Sigileth describes her return from the Fearwater with her brother and Cúridwan.
'Look there! The animals... pass us by.'
Ask Sigileth what she believes happened
Hear the remainder of Sigileth's account
Hear what Corudan had to say
Sigileth describes her return from the Fearwater with her brother and Cúridwan.
'Such wrathful spirits have been known to deceive!'
'The storm has passed. Now only a light breeze remains.'
'So too do the birds of the sky.'
'There is nothing for which you must apologize, my brother.'
'The breeze, and the animals, and the birds...'
'No. I feel it too.'
'...all these pass westward.'
'We are not alone, are we?'
'What do you know of this, Cúridwan?'
'Silirtas?'
'You may not remember, Silirtas. But I do.'
'We only knew each other for a few short days.'
'But in that time, your struggle touched my heart.'
'Every day of our lives is dangerous!'
Learn the severity of Corudan's injuries
'Cúridwan did her best to heal his injuries...'
Follow Sigileth's account of her return from the Fearwater
'...but he needed more than she could give him in the wild.'
Hear what Cúridwan had to say about Corudan's injuries
